Generation II.Gold: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won't grow.
Generation II.Silver: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.
Generation II.Crystal: Because of its rubbery, electricity-resistant skin, it can store lots of electricity in its fur.
Generation II.Stadium 2: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won't grow. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Flaaffy 's wool quality changes so that it can generate a high amount of static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.
Generation III.Sapphire: Flaaffy 's wool quality changes so that it can generate a high amount of static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.
Generation III.Emerald: Its fleece quality changes to generate strong static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare, slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.
Generation III.FireRed: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.
Generation III.LeafGreen: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won't grow.

Generation IV.Diamond: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.
Generation IV.Pearl: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.
Generation IV.Platinum: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.
Generation IV.HeartGold: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won't grow.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.

Generation V.Black: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.
Generation V.White: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.
Generation V.Black 2: Not even downy wool will grow on its rubbery, nonconductive patches of skin that prevent electrical shock.
Generation V.White 2: Not even downy wool will grow on its rubbery, nonconductive patches of skin that prevent electrical shock.

Generation VI.X: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.
Generation VI.Y: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Flaaffy's wool quality changes so that it can generate a high amount of static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Flaaffy's wool quality changes so that it can generate a high amount of static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: In the places on its body where fleece doesn't grow, its skin is rubbery and doesn't conduct electricity. Those spots are safe to touch.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It stores electricity in its fluffy fleece. If it stores up too much, it will start to go bald in those patches.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. Flaaffy can fire hair that zaps on impact.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. Flaaffy can fire hair that zaps on impact.

Generation IX.Scarlet: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won’t grow.
Generation IX.Violet: Because of its rubbery, electricity-resistant skin, it can store lots of electricity in its fur.
